bibl.title: Land and Power in Ptolemaic Egypt. The Structure of Land Tenure.
bibl.note: Part I. Issues and historical Background (1. Issues and methodologies; - 2. The Ptolemaic state and its antecedents). - Part II. Regional case studies of land tenure (3. The land tenure regime in Upper Egypt; - 4. The land tenure regime in the Fayyum depression). - Part III. Interpretation (5. The Ptolemaic state, the land tenure regime, and economic power; - 6. The private transmission of land; - 7. Conclusions). - Appendices. Indices.
bibl.seg: MANNING Joseph G., Land and Power in Ptolemaic Egypt. The Structure of Land Tenure.
Cambridge, Cambridge University Press, 2003, 8°, xxi-335 pp., tabl., diagrammes, 2 cartes. ISBN 0-521-81924-5. £50.

Part I. Issues and historical Background (1. Issues and methodologies; - 2. The Ptolemaic state and its antecedents). - Part II. Regional case studies of land tenure (3. The land tenure regime in Upper Egypt; - 4. The land tenure regime in the Fayyum depression). - Part III. Interpretation (5. The Ptolemaic state, the land tenure regime, and economic power; - 6. The private transmission of land; - 7. Conclusions). - Appendices. Indices.

C.R. par Werner Huss, Gnomon 78 (2006) pp. 234-237. - Peter C. Nadig, BMCRev < http://ccat.sas.upenn.edu/bmcr/2004/2004-06-41.html >. - Jean A. Straus, AntCl 74 (2005) pp. 517-518. - Brian McGing, CR N.S., 57 (2007) pp. 160-162. - Kai Ruffing, MBAH 24 (2005) No. 1, pp. 116-119. - Arthur Verhoogt, BASP 43 (2006) pp. 193-194. - K. Vandorpe, Topoi 14 (2006) pp. 601-603.
